Understate: The claim may understate the availability of child-only insurance options in Florida after the enactment of the federal health care law.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough supporting evidence or materials to back up the statement.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the elimination of certain child-only insurance options in Florida is solely due to the law's consumer protections, without considering other factors.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the elimination of certain child-only insurance options in Florida, which are not explored or mentioned in the claim.
